page.title: 05CALKE CHURCH
page.content: The present church of St Giles, in Calke Park, was built in 1820. It is a small church standing on a hill overlooking Calke Abbey with an ivy covered tower over the entrance on the West side. The tower houses the bell and harmonium. Down the short aisle there are 9 rows of enclosed seats. On the walls,covered to 1 metre high with woven rushes,are 3 tablets dedicated to past generations of the Harpur-Crewe family. The East window is unusual in that the stained glass is set in wrought iron. Throughout the church are candle holders as there is no electricity. Surrounding the graveyard is a metre ha-ha with an avenue of lime trees leading off on the north side, down to the abbey. Services are irregular.
